data.content:
noun
[noncount] the walls, furniture, trees, etc., that are used on a stage during a play or other performance to show where the action is taking place
She designed the scenery for the play.
The scenery showed a forest/bedroom.
a view of natural features (such as mountains, hills, valleys, etc.) that is pleasing to look at
beautiful mountain scenery
We went for a drive to enjoy the scenery.
the things that can be seen where a person lives, works, etc. - used in the phrase change of scenery
He was looking for a new job because he felt he needed a change of scenery. [=he needed to be in a different place]
We decided to go to a new restaurant for a change of scenery.

Danh từ
phong cảnh
stop to admire the scenery
dừng lại để ngắm phong cảnh
dụng cụ dựng cảnh (trên sân khấu)
